body: That code will only ever be called from the main thread.

In my case I have embedded GLFW in some DLL that statically link it,
then the main application load them to create the window,
so the windows class with GetModuleHandleW (NULL) will point to the main exe application,
after loaded the first DLL and create the window,
not allow you to create other window from the other DLL call, because the class is already registered.
So the my code proposal, resolve this scenario.

Okay. That has nothing to do with threads, though.

Why not put GLFW in its own DLL and link your ones to that? GLFW wasn't written with multiple copies per process in mind.

My DLL per se are mini applications already with its window that are loaded as a plugin,
and I use the GLFW to create additional opengl child window to link with the parent.

I hope that this solution can be adopted on other platforms, to have multiple copies per process.
I don't see how any of that precludes having GLFW as its own DLL.

The glfw3.lib is already static linked with my DLL.
Maybe I did not understand what you mean?
Just to clarify the scenario, the main application is not managed by me, it loads my DLL as plugins.

issue.title: GLFW support for Windows
issue.body:
I would like to request feature, where image would be rendered using only textureId, that was already created and rendered into by OpenGL.

Many existing imgui frameworks accept only textureId to draw images.

Thank you

body: This should be fixed now with 07a5518c3e42f4412a5d9fa8620950d8f5041e28, which works mostly the same way. Thank you for the bug report and for you patience.
